intro: Voyria uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower voyria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
